이 곳의 성운 지대에는 락맨 함선이 졸탄 국경 경찰을 피해 숨어있습니다. 그들의 위치한 곳의 좌표를 알고 있는 당신을 순순히 떠나게 해줄 생각이 없는 듯 합니다. 공격해옵니다!
계속...
해적함 두 척이 이 성운에 잠복해있는 것이 느껴집니다. 해적들은 아직 당신의 기척을 눈치채지 못한 것 같습니다. 그들의 화물을 스캐너로 분석해 본 결과 한 척은 연료를, 다른 한 척은 탄약을 적재하고 있습니다. 이들은 플라즈마 폭풍을 타고 각자 떠나가기 시작합니다.
연료를 뺏자.
연료를 적재한 해적선과 교전에 들어갔습니다 – 이 우주선을 온전히 굴복시킬 수 있었으면 좋겠군요
계속...
탄약을 뺏자.
탄약을 적재한 해적선과 교전에 들어갔습니다 – 이 우주선을 온전히 굴복시킬 수 있었으면 좋겠군요
계속...
살려보내주자.
때로는 분별력이 용기보다 나을 때가 있습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
졸탄 엔지니어로 가득 차있는 함선이 당신을 맞이합니다. 원자로를 무료로 업그레이드해주겠다고 제안하고 있습니다.
한 밀수업자 함선이 당신을 부릅니다. "안녕하신가 곧 친구가 될 이들이여! 우리가 최근 벌이고 있는 사업을 그닥 좋아하지 않는 졸탄 경찰들과 좀 문제가 생겼다네. 우리가 가지고 있는 자원을 가져가서 이곳에서 더 빨리 나갈 수 있게 해주겠나?"
거래에 동의한다.
거절한다.
졸탄이 없애고 싶어하는 밀수품을 팔고 있는것이라면 그들과 연관되지 않는게 최선입니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
갑자기 졸탄 함선이 어딘가에서 등장합니다! 겁에 질린 밀수업자들은 달아나고, 당신은 경찰들을 상대해야 합니다.
계속...
당신은 졸탄의 연구시설에 도착했습니다. They say they are researching genetic distortion due to stasis sleep and prolonged FTL travel. They ask if your crew has the time to undergo a few scans.
Participate in their study.
Decline.
"Alright. Fly safe." You prepare to leave.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
(Advanced Medbay) Give them your medical records.
"Thank you! We didn't expect to receive such a significant amount of data regarding your crew's health during FTL travel. Please, accept this for your trouble."
(Shell Crew) Request an exchange with the Zoltan science team.

Overjoyed to come across this opportunity after having remained in Shell space for so long, your Shell has many subjects to discuss, most of which are beyond your understanding. Following a long debate and brainstorming sessions with the Zoltans, they finally are able to return to you, and offer a drone schematic in thanks.
(Hibernating Alien) Ask if they know what to do with this.

"Interesting... I have never seen a creature like this. I'm afraid there's not much we can do with it however, its current state is unrelated to stasis sleep. However, with a catalyst, such as quantum fuel, you may be able to awaken it again?"

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."

Your crew calmly lines up for the Zoltans to take their readings. After a short time, the process is done. They contact you, "Thank you for your participation in our study. Please accept these small cakes made from stiff dough as well as some scrap."
As soon as you dock, pirates burst on board and a hostile ship appears on the radar. You hear the Zoltans yell in the distance, "We're being held hostage!"
계속...

Though not all Zoltans choose to align with the extreme views of the Duskbringers, that doesn't mean they all appreciate the Federation. A particularly annoyed Zoltan Elite appears to be fed up with tolerating Federation ships and has decided to attack.
계속...
계속...
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/textL: A hostile Duskbringer ship intercepts you, spouting nonsense about the inevitable fall of the Federation.
The Duskbringers have been gaining rapid support amongst the Zoltan populace, so it's of no surprise you have discovered one of their ships at this beacon.
"Your last mistake was entering Zoltan territory, repugnant Federation scum!" An irate Duskbringer ship attacks.
It appears a Duskbringer ship has just finished off a Zoltan police ship, and decides to target you next.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: 계속...
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/textL: The Rockmen and Zoltans have been on good terms for longer than the Federation has been around. Unfortunately, this means plenty of Rock ships can be found here, and they usually aren't very friendly.
"You have upset the gods by coming here, Federation Cruiser!" You have no idea what they are talking about, but a Rock ship visiting this Zoltan sector approaches, weapons armed and ready.
A Rock ship swoops in to attack. It's no surprise to see a Rock ship in Zoltan space, but it's unusual for them to be so aggressive without even a reason.
It seems you're out of luck... a hostile Rock ship has already explored this beacon and upon seeing you decides it wants to fight!
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: 계속...
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/textL: "I've been growing tired of these pompous energy freaks, a Fed ship will be a nice change!" A Rebel ship locks onto you and fires its entire salvo. Man the battle-stations!

Rebels are known for their xenophobia, but when it comes to the Zoltan race they have an especially exaggerated hatred. A Rebel ship hunting for Zoltans to kill spots you and decides to delay their search to attack you.
"I suspected you might try to run here, hoping for protection by your precious Zoltan allies! Well you were wrong to think you'd be safe here, because I too have arrived!"
A Rebel ship approaches fast! They must have known this was Federation-allied territory and came to hunt for ships such as yours.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: 계속...
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/textL: There's a tinge of irony how common pirates are in Zoltan territory despite how hard their government tries to rid of them. Unfortunately, they usually aren't happy to see your ship!
A pirate ship appears to be attempting to set up a small market here, but when they spot you they ditch their efforts and in-turn attack!
A hostile pirate ship moves in to fight you, despite the Zoltan Peace-Keepers that supposedly protect this sector trying desperately to clear it of pirate forces.
"I wonder how much the Zoltans would pay me for as bounty for capturing an illegal Multiverse vessel!" A pirate ship swoops in, with malicious thoughts on their mind.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: A Zoltan Automated ship appears to be in charging mode nearby this sun... probably harvesting the solar energy! However, it appears you arrives just in time for it to re-activate, and the ship somehow identifies you as a threat.
계속...

A crazed ship of Zoltans hails you, their raspy voices suggesting they've gone mad with some sort of sickness. "Hahahah! The energy of the pulsar, it is mine! I shall become one with it! I shall become the pulsar! Die mortal, be killed by my power!"
계속...

The Free Mantis and Zoltan don't get along well, so it's concerning to see a Free Mantis ship so far into Zoltan space. A ship from the peacekeeper border police has docked with a massive Free Mantis ship, which can't mean anything good.
Board as well and see what's happening.

You step into the ship only to find a Peacekeeper violently kicking a defenseless Free Mantis warlord on the ground, who is desperately screaming "Stop, stop! I not wanting violence, only friendlyness!", but the Zoltan won't listen.
Pull the Zoltan off of the Free Mantis.

You grab at the Zoltan, pulling them away from the Free Mantis. They shove you away, shouting "What the hell are you doing? All your precious Federation can do now is interfere with foreign matters, isn't that so? I'll put you in your god damn place!" The Zoltan gives orders for his men to attack!
계속...
Try to reason with the Zoltan.

You try to reason with the Peacekeeper, but it only infuriates them further. "The Federation should know their place, instead of always interfering with foreign matters. Maybe the Duskbringers are right, and all of you filth deserve to die." The Peacekeeper gives orders for his men to attack!
계속...
(Ministry Allied Zoltan Crew) Have your Zoltan reason with them.
(Zoltan Deleter) Begone.

It only takes a single shot to erase the peace-keeper from existence. You help the Free Mantis to their feet. "Thanking you very much Federation, we come here only make friends, but Zoltan not trust us. Me coming with you, much friendlier."
Ignore the ships.
There's no way you're messing with the Zoltan border police in the Zoltan Capital.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.

"What are you doing? Is this really keeping the peace? The Ministry stands for lawful justice, and yet here you are attacking a defenseless Mantis! Is this what you signed up to the force for?" The Peacekeeper falters for a moment. "I- don't try and get involved in things that have nothing to do with you, Federation!" The Zoltan begins to say more, but is immediately sliced in twain by the Free Mantis, who crawled off the floor while the Zoltan was distracted. You hurry back to the ship before the Peacekeeper ship notices something is wrong, but it's too late. You escape from the ship, but a team of Zoltan beam aboard your ship!
계속...

Despite the arrogant nature of the Zoltans regarding their supposedly superior government, many of their kind are dissatisfied with the strict and controlling Zoltan Peace-Keepers instated to, as their name would suggest, 'keep the peace'. It appears a full on riot has started on the nearby planet.
Pull closer to survey the chaos.

It seems the conflict was incited by a Duskbringer soldier giving a rather motivating speech, which inevitably resulted in complete and utter destruction, as civilians overturn Peace-Keeper ground vehicles and orbital satellites open fire on crowds of innocent people trying to flee for their life.
Take part in the battle - help the Zoltan civilians.
You've made up your mind to help the civilians. You attack one of the Peace-Keeper vessels.
계속...
Take part in the battle - help the Peace-Keepers.
You've made up your mind to help the Peace-Keepers. You attack one of the Duskbringer vessels.
계속...
(Cloaking) Cloak and loot some of the buildings while everyone is distracted.
You swoop down to collect some supplies as quickly as possible before leaving.
Pull away quickly.
This isn't our business, 무시한다 them.
It's not your duty to get involved in the business of everyone else you encounter. You 무시한다 the chaos below.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.

The civilians manage to fight back the Peace-Keeper forces, who flee from the scene before more casualties can occur. It appears your efforts did not go unnoticed either, and the civilians bring you a large reward for your assistance.

The civilians manage to fight back the Peace-Keeper forces, who flee from the scene before more casualties can occur. It appears your efforts did not go unnoticed either, and the civilians bring you a large reward for your assistance.
Unfortunately, it seems your efforts were in vain. The civilians are defeated and the Peace-Keepers retake the city. You flee before they can chase you off themselves.

As you expected, the Peace-Keepers quickly retake the sector from the Duskbringers and begin making arrests. It appears you chose to help the right side, because the Peace-Keepers have taken note of your efforts at assisting them and pay you in scrap.

It appears your efforts were in vain, as the Duskbringer forces beat back the Peace-Keepers and slowly take control over the city. As the Capital forces flee, a lone soldier runs to your ship and offers to join you so they can escape.

While scrapping the hull of the Duskbringer ship, a massive explosion erupts from one of the nearby buildings! Your ship takes some damage but luckily you pull away in time before it can be compromised. Another series of explosions rocks the city, as buildings crumble to the ground! A squadron of Duskbringer bombs descend from the sky, reducing the city to ashes. You fly away as quickly as possible.
A Zoltan and Duskbringer ship appear to be involved in a heated debate on a topic you cannot discern.
Hail them and question them.

The two ships don't even bother to address your presence and continue to argue. They seem to be arguing over the proper spelling of capital, with the Zoltan saying it's spelled with an A, and the Duskbringer saying it's spelled with an O.
It's spelled with an A.
It doesn't take much to drive a Duskbringer to attack a Federation vessel, and they proceed to do exactly that. The Zoltan ship, frightened, jumps away.
Continue...
It's spelled with an O.
The Duskbringer captain chuckles, but the Zoltan seems deeply offended. Their weapons go online, and the Duskbringer jumps away so they don't have to feel obligated to assist you.
Continue...
It depends on the context, really.
The two Zoltans briefly glance at you before continuing with their argument. You figure it's a good time to leave.
Ignore them.
You leave the two ships to their arguing and continue on your mission.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
It appears a pirate ship here is under arrest by a Zoltan ship. They've secretly activated the distress beacon, and have sent you a short message saying "help".
Assist the pirates and attack the Zoltans.
You arm the weapons and engage the Zoltan vessel.
Continue...
Report the pirates to the Zoltan.
The Zoltan gruffly thank you and give you some fuel, then go back to dealing with the pirates.
Ignore the pirates.
The pirates send you no future messages and are all brought aboard the Zoltan ship, which jumps away shortly after.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
It appears the pirates were slavers. Grateful for your assistance, they offer you one of their 'workers' for free.
The pirates appear to be mercenaries, ironically hired to hunt you down by the Rebels. After an awkward silence, you work out a deal, and they promise to lie to the fleet.
The pirates appear to be smugglers. They explain that their client snitched on them and led to their arrest. Now that you've saved them, they offer to sell to you instead.
A Zoltan Peace Brigade is under heavy fire at this beacon by a battalion of Rebel fighters. The distress beacon comes from the commanding ship. They appear to be too busy to notice you.
Hail them and offer assistance.

It's hard to hear the Zoltan commander over the sounds of gunfire on their ship. "What?! Oh, you've come to provide assistance? We need all the help we can, there's numerous Rebel ships attacking this system! If you're going to help, be quick about it!"
Attack one of the smaller Rebel ships.
Several Rebel ships are scattered around the perimeter, swooping in to assist their comrades when necessary. You pick a ship at random and attack.
Continue...
Take on one of the Elite ships.
The burden of the attack is being carried out by Elite vessels. You intercept one of them and attack.
Continue...
Take on the ship leading the squadron.
A powerful MFK Ace is leading the Rebels. If you can destroy it, the Zoltan might be able to win this battle.
Continue...
This is chaos, leave.
You salvage the remains of the Rebel ship while the battle rages on in the distance.
Continue...
The Zoltan are too busy dealing with the conflict to reward you, so you decide it's a good time to leave before another Rebel ship attacks you.
You salvage the remains of the Elite Rebel ship while the battle rages on in the distance.
Continue...
The Zoltan are too busy dealing with the conflict to reward you, so you decide it's a good time to leave before another Rebel ship attacks you.
The MFK Ace has been neutralized. You salvage the remains of the ship.
Continue...

Around you the battle begins to die down. The Rebels, watching you defeat their leader, reconsider and begin to jump away. In a matter of minutes the Zoltan forces go from near defeat to conclusive victory.
Contact the Zoltans.
"You have saved us from a terrible defeat. We are grateful for your assistance. Allow me to repay our debt to you."
To your surprise, this beacon is inhabited by a Lanius vessel! They don't attack, but instead send you a message.
Respond.

"Offer asking. Green! Force want. Core Zoltan collect, bring us." It's hard to understand, but after further discussion it seems the Lanius are interested in the Zoltan shields on this sector's inhabitants, and are asking you for a favor. Capture a Zoltan ship and bring to the Lanius their shield's core, and they will pay you.
Agree.
"Greater. Location sending." The Lanius attach the co-ordinates of the ship they are wanting the core from.
Decline.
Attack!
If the Lanius aren't going to attack, then you will!
Continue...
Ignore the Lanius.
The Lanius eventually jump away after realizing you don't intend on responding.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The Lanius aren't pleased by being ignored... they arm their weapons and attack!
Continue...
The co-ordinates have led you to a regular Zoltan ship. If you want the core, you'll have to clear them of inhabitants first.
Attack!
You arm the weapons and approach the Zoltan ship.
Continue...
These Zoltan haven't done anything to us, leave them alone.
You decide not to fight the Zoltan.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
The co-ordinates have lead you to a regular Zoltan station. If you want the core, you'll have to clear them of inhabitants first.
Attack!
You arm the weapons and approach the Zoltan station.
Continue...
These Zoltan haven't done anything to us, leave them alone.
You decide not to fight the Zoltan.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

The co-ordinates have lead you to a Duskbringer vessel! They immediately detect that you are a Federation ship and attack. You'll have to fight them either way, but if you want the core you'll have to kill their crew.
Continue...

The co-ordinates have lead you to a Zoltan Monk! They hail you, "the stars have told us you would come here, in search of the heart that powers our ship. If you wish to take it, you must test your mind."
Agree to "test your mind".

The Monks lead you to a room shrouded in complete darkness, and lock the door. You wait inside for several hours completely alone. Right when you think you are about to go insane, you drift into a deep sleep. When you awake, you are back on the ship with a monk and the core!
Continue...
(Monk Crew) Negotiate with them for the core.
Your Monk crew member seems to have been able to convince the others to give you their core.
Continue...
Screw the riddle, attack them.
You arm the weapons and approach the Monk ship. However, it seems the Monks are trying to escape!
Continue...
The co-ordinates have lead you to an automated Zoltan ship. It seems to be in rest mode, so maybe you can stealthily extract the core?
Attempt to salvage the core.
(Hacking) Hack the Auto-ship to keep it offline.
It appears you are successful! The Auto-ship remains offline.
Inspect the core.
(Cloaking) Cloak the ship while extracting the core.
It appears you are successful! The Auto-ship remains offline.
Inspect the core.
Ignore the Auto-ship.
You decide not to attempt to extract the core from the Zoltan Auto-ship.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
It appears you are successful! The Auto-ship remains offline.
Inspect the core.
Your attempt was unsuccessful. The Auto-ship recognizes you and attacks!
Continue...

You observe the core. Now that it has been removed from the ship you can't seem to tell how to reverse engineer it, but you assume the Lanius are aware of that and know how to fix it. However... you might be able to use this to upgrade your regular shields.
Bring the core to the Lanius for your reward.
You contact the Lanius and get their new co-ordinates.
Dismantle the core and use it to upgrade your shields.
You won't be able to get your reward now, but your shield system is running better than ever.
You deliver the core to the Lanius ship. "Favor am glad. Bits are belonging you." They transfer over some supplies and offer to trade further.

At first, you assume the nearby planet isn't anything important - until your Atlas informs you this is actually the location of the Zoltan Capital! Usually these places are better marked, but Ministry government buildings are rarely seen as tourist attractions. You expected the capital to be on the Zoltan Homeworlds, Osmia, but this most certainly isn't any such place.
Visit the capital.

As soon as you approach, it's clear something is eerily wrong. There is barely any activity on the streets near the massive capitol building, and you swear you see several armed patrols stationed outside. Your descent is met with a warning; "Unregistered foreign vessel - desist at once and leave this zone. This is not a time for complacent intervention from reckless third parties."
We aren't a reckless third party - we're Federation.
"I understand that. My statement still stands. This is a matter of importance for the Ministry and the Ministry alone. Now beat it."
(Ministry Crew) Talk them into allowing you to assist.
(Harmony Crew) Talk them into allowing you to assist.
(Zoltan Shield) Convince them you are a Zoltan ship.
Insist on helping anyways.
The Zoltan doesn't bother speaking to you, instead calling on his radio for backup in dispersing you!
Continue...
It seems there's no convincing these guys.
Abide that warning and leave.
There's no point in visiting.
You have no interest in bothering the Zoltan citizens or sight seeing.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

"It seems I have misevaluated your aptitude. I am Allta Foleck, regent and speaker on behalf of Minister Lumei who is not present at this time. As you perhaps have noticed, the capitol has been evacuated, and the city is under lockdown in face of an impending terrorist attack.
Terrorists? Is it the Duskbringers?

Allta hesitates, but eventually responds: "Not quite. We believe they are a more radical, religious sect of the Duskbringers, almost cult like. They have donned masks of hideous three-eyed beasts and wear sacrificial robes, and their only goal is the total annihilation of the Ministry. We have received news that their forces will be arriving soon and they must be apprehended. Death is the only suitable consequence for these acts of terror."
Agree to stay and help fight the terrorists.

Not too long later, you catch sight of the first of the terrorist vessels approaching. A decently sized cruiser vessel and very well armed, it looks like this is your chance to earn the Ministry's favor.
Continue...
Yeah uh, have fun dealing with those guys. We're out of here.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/ship[: The strange Zoltan vessel has been vanquished. It causes some damage to the infastructure below when it crashes into the ground, but the Zoltan officials tell you not to worry.
The strange Zoltan vessel has been vanquished. It causes some damage to the infastructure below when it crashes into the ground, but the Zoltan officials tell you not to worry.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: It seems that, having gotten so low on crew, the ship is now attempting to flee. You don't see this kind of behavior often, but you receive word from Allta. "Do not let that ship escape! We must ensure the terrorists cannot regroup!"
Keep fighting.
(Analyzer) Suggest allowing the ship to escape and track its movements.
(LR Jump) Suggest allowing the ship to escape and track its movements.
(LRS) Suggest allowing the ship to escape and track its movements.
(Adv. Sensors) Suggest allowing the ship to escape and track its movements.
"Absolutely not! You are under direct orders to keep firing on that ship until they are dead! Do NOT attempt to follow them, they are dangerous and must be stopped!"
Keep fighting.

The terrorist ship jumps away. You can tell Allta is mad, but he manages to maintain his professional composure despite his wavering voice. "Very well then. This is not the most optimal outcome, but... we can make do with this. The capital has been saved, thanks to your efforts. Heheh..."
Continue...
Grab the coordinates of the terrorist ship's new location first.

While you speak further with Allta, you proceed to discretely download the trajectory and coordinates of the strange Zoltan ship. You aren't sure where this will lead, but clearly there's something there the Ministry doesn't want anyone near.
Continue...

You can't help but notice no other ships were present during the attack, and the Zoltan military forces were... very reserved in that they refused to assist you in the fight. Strange, but Allta appears once again to commemorate you. "I think it goes without saying that without your help, we would not have been able to survive that attack. Allow me to show my generosity to both you and the Federation. Now, feel free to carry on with your mission. I would hate to steal any more of your time." You aren't sure where this sudden attitude shift came from, but as promised Allta does deliver a rather large reward, including ship blueprints for a Zoltan cruiser!
Accept the gift and leave.
We have some questions left to ask.
"Oh? Questions? I'm a very busy man I'm afraid. I'll try to entertain your thoughts, but I cannot stick around for long."
Why did none of the other ships help us?

"We could see that you had the situation under control. With ships as deadly as theirs, we were not willing to risk our more valuable security teams unless necessary. Many citizens and ground patrols were not given full information on the events that were to transpire to ensure there would be no hysteria. That is all, I hope you were not offended."
Continue...
Why were there no other ships attacking?

"It would seem that we were largely misinformed on the scale of the attack. You see, informants can't get everything right all of the time... With this vessel dealt with, I am certain the terrorists will hesitate before making future attacks, but should we ever need help in the future, I suppose we know who to call... Heheh..."
Continue...
Why were those terrorists' masks so realistic?

"What reasonable man could try and justify the absurd efforts of mentally unstable zealots? Their dedication to their craft is, as some would say, remarkable, but I would sooner call it disturbing. Never fear though, those ghastly creatures are just the same as all Zoltan, and thank goodness for it!"
Continue...
That's all of our questions.

"Good, good. You are a very curious individual I see. I appreciate your drive to know more about the galaxy around you, but I must warn you. Try not to go sticking your nose into business you have no part in the future, okay? Bye bye!" Allta immediately hangs up from the call, and an escort is dispatched to ensure you have a 'safe flight' as you leave the capital.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/ship[: You've defeated the ship of so-called Osmians. There wasn't much point - the Ministry isn't exactly going to give you a second reward - but at least this mystery is over. Right?
You've defeated the ship of so-called Osmians. There wasn't much point - the Ministry isn't exactly going to give you a second reward - but at least this mystery is over. Right?
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: Location of the terrorists.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

As soon as you arrive at the location of the terrorists you're taken aback by the location on your Atlas. THIS is Osmia, homeworld of the Zoltan race. Unlike the capital, which at least had a minor indicator of importance upon arrival, Osmia has no such fanfare. How has the Ministry kept an entire planet hidden from the rest of the Federation - and more importantly, why?
Continue...

As you follow the coordinates closer to the surface you can see the planet has seen much better days. Similar to most of the homeworlds of galactic empires, it lays in a state of mass disarray, but this is much different. Vegetation is completely absent from almost half of the planet, and that where it can be found it grows erratically. Ancient craters decorate the surface and near them is large amounts of radioactivity. You steer clear of the dead-zones and approach a massive elevated city suspended by several large towers. This is no ruin however - it's bustling with activity.
Continue...

Suddenly, you're stopped by the same ship as before. Their dialect is strange, though close enough to modern Zoltan that your translator fills in the gaps easily. "Please tell us you have not come to finish us off! Whatever the Ministry has told you is a lie! Please, you must understand, we aren't a threat!"
You attacked the capital - that seems pretty threatening.

"Look, let me explain! I am Malki, and we are the Osmians. We are not terrorists, I can promise you. We are the last of the few non-transformants that the Ministry could not reach. If you care, I can start from the beginning and explain everything. But I believe you might be of a great help to my people, if you're willing."
Listen to his explanation.
We're in a bit of a hurry here.
Don't trust these guys - attack!
You ignore the protests of Malki and silence the ship before moving in to attack.
Continue...

"Okay, okay. Look, why don't we both power down our weapons and meet face to face? If you came this far, you're certainly looking for answers." Reluctantly, you agree and you land your ship near the frozen lake. Malki dismounts from his vessel, revealing himself to look the same as the creatures from before.
The Ministry said you were disguised Duskbringers.

"I'm afraid that's a lie. One of many. As you can see, we are not Zoltan in the same sense that you know. Long long before the Federation, all of us Zoltan looked this way. Back then, we were steaming ahead full force into the interstellar era, driven to be the first of many competing nations. But this competition turned to travesty, and nuclear holocaust became imminent. Osmia was annihilated, and the survivors were forced to flee the planet. For almost centuries Osmia was out of our reach, a solemn reminder of our failure."
Continue...

"The lost explorers roamed the surrounding nebula, unable to settle for long without devolving into war once again. However, in those mysterious clouds they found something. At the center of the infamous Great Eye nebula was a monolith that held immense, god-like power. The Zoltan came to worship it, and so it brought them unity. This gave birth to the Illesctrian faith and the Ministry who sought to uphold this new peace. The Ministry, however, was brutal with its enforcement, and to justify its cruelty the leadership constructed an ever-large and rapidly expanding codex of laws no man nor army could ever memorize. Through force they assimilated every last Zoltan colony."
But what happened? Why are the Zoltan hard-light now?

"Yes, see, the Great Eye also brought with it the discovery of other, similar tech. Aether, a highly conductive and resistant metal alloy used to forge the ruins around the Eye could be used to create sustainable hard-light generators. This tech enticed the Ministry's top scientists, who saw it as a solution for the Osmia crisis alongside various other tech. Though Aether was used to construct most of Zoltan kind's most infamous technology like our special shields, we also used it to create new part-organic part-mechanical forms to explore Osmia with. This was a success and the explorers were revered as heroes, and many flocked back to recolonize the planet. The current Minister at the time only lived for a little longer until he succumbed to a natural death and was replaced by the new Minister, Lumei."
Wait, but wasn't this centuries ago? How is Lumei still in charge?

"This was indeed long ago, but we'll get to the answer for your question soon enough. Under Lumei's leadership the codex was almost doubled in size and enforcement became even stricter. The Osmian explorers, still held high in reverency by the public, were given seats in the Ministry so Lumei could keep them close to him as pawns. Because of the connection between Aether and the Great Eye, these hard-light forms took on a religious significance as well, and so Lumei himself underwent transformation to secure his power. As the technology became better researched soon the wealthy elite, priests, and eventually even the common people were able to afford such procedures. Supremacy of the tranformants took hold and, fearful that this divide might create a split between the Zoltan, the Ministry began to normalize and enforce transformancy."
Continue...

"Most adamant non-transformants died of natural causes and the newer more 'progressive' mindset took hold. All Zoltan over the age of 7 were to be immediately transitioned into hard-light chassis. The only place the Ministry struggled to touch was, ironically, Osmia itself. A group of non-transformants had taken hold there, seizing control of the territory between the wastelands that had survived the initial holocaust. Eventually the Ministry gave up and spent their effort erasing the importance of Osmia from the rest of the Zoltan - something made easier by the recent discovery of other sapient life. And so, that is how the first of we Osmians came to be. The Ministry wants nothing more than for the galaxy to forget we exist and for us to die out naturally."
So, what is it that you needed of us?

"Yes, well I suppose it's best I explain why we were there at the capital then, before I ask of you anything... You see, there are a few of our kind left which have not taken refuge on Osmia. They were captured by the Ministry and kept locked away in a secret laboratory under 'protocol 3,' in the case of an unforeseen cataclysmic failure of the hard-light forms. We estimate there's likely several hundred of them locked away from centuries ago - each of them an innocent life, as well as a time capsule for ancient forgotten history. We hoped to storm the Capital and force them to release the captives, but as you can see that didn't work out as planned."
Whoops. Sorry about that.

"Don't be. We understand your alliance with the Ministry as part of the Federation took precedence. But now, I'm afraid I must ask of you a favor that is not in the interest of that alliance. Our military is not strong enough to take on the vessel guarding the lab, and our only ship capable, you caused quite the damage to. We cannot offer you the same as the Ministry might, so I expect nothing more than your refusal. But if you accept this plea out of the kindness of your heart, then you will forever have the Osmian people's gratitude."
Agree to rescue the captives.

"Really? I cannot believe this. But I haven't time to thank you any further. I must encourage you to hurry, I cannot say if the Ministry will take action to further protect the specimens in the face of our actions or not. I'll transfer the coordinates immediately. Our transports will be on the way shortly after you arrive. Best of luck. Our people are counting on you."
Decline.
"Understandable. At least I can thank you for allowing us to continue to exist as we were. Best of luck on your travels."
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/ship[: The peacekeepers have been defeated. You expect more reinforcements, but it seems the lab just intends to surrender instead. The Ministry is desperate to hide this truth, but apparently not enough to risk a full-scale war.

The peacekeepers have been defeated. You expect more reinforcements, but it seems the lab just intends to surrender instead. The Ministry is desperate to hide this truth, but apparently not enough to risk a full-scale war.
data/events_zoltan.xml.append$/FTL/event: Location of the secret Ministry Lab.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

There is zero doubt in your mind this is the place. Just from the immediate sinister appearance, it's clear this is not an ordinary secret base - if there ever was one. According to the Osmians the security must be tight, and getting any closer without being detected is unavoidable.
Pull closer.
As soon as you cross a certain threshold, a peace-keeper vessel activates. Almost the size of a cruiser, this ship is no idle threat. "Entrance to Zone E17 is forbidden. How did you find this place?"
No question - time to fight.
You're done being told what to do by the Ministry. Time to finally give them what they've had coming for a long time.
Continue...
Oops sorry we're lost. We'll leave!
Leave.
You've bitten off more than you can chew this time. The Osmians will need to find someone else to help them.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

Your radar immediately picks up several more pings. You're afraid this means the Zoltans have received reinforcements - but this isn't the case. In fact, it's quite the opposite. The Osmians have arrived, and unlike most of your "allies" in conflicts like this, they're actually providing firepower from the sidelines!

The Osmian troops, though limited in ships, are plentiful in manpower and storm the lab. The Zoltan scientists surrender. You take note of assorted Engi and even a few workers in Federation garb in the crowd, but you're distracted by Malki. "Thank you for your help. Though material offers I cannot extend, I can provide your Federation blueprints for our finest warship. We-" Suddenly, an alarm blares. Something bad is happening!
Continue...

Shortly after the alarm, another warning plays over the stereo. You might be getting tired of all these warnings, but this isn't one to be ignored. "Evacuate the premises immediately. Nuclear strike imminent." Panic immediately breaks out, and your radar detects an approaching warhead. Apparently, in case of emergency, the Ministry rigged this place to destroy itself. If your holopad's estimation is correct, you have 10 minutes before the impact.
Assist the Osmians in moving the stasis pods.

Your crew rush over to help, disengaging the pods from their holding compartments and carrying them over to the awaiting Osmian transport vessels. As the timer continues to tick down, you realize there's a much greater issue than the time limit - there isn't enough space for all of the specimens. Malki notices too and is dismayed. "What will we do now? There isn't enough time for multiple trips!"
We have to leave them behind!
(Strong Crew) Haul some of the pods onto your ship.

With the other transports full, the only option is to load the chambers onto your own ship. You bring as many back as possible, but you can't help but notice Malki is still rushing around fruitlessly trying to fit more containers on the other ships.
Urge him to leave.
We've done our part - leave!
You apologize to Malki, but he hardly notices as he's already run off to help move as many stasis chambers as possible. You hurry back to your ship and prepare to leave.

"Are you insane? We didn't come this far just to leave them behind! We- we have to rescue as many as we can!" You try to explain there isn't possibly enough time to move them all, but Malki won't listen. Eventually, through force, you manage to drag him back to your ship as the rest of the Osmians flee. Though you weren't able to save all of the specimens and the scientists are doomed, at least all of the Osmians and your crew were able to make it away safely.
Continue...

From the distance as you leave the planet behind you can see the flash of the detonation. In grim silence Malki watches, unresponsive. "I have failed my people. But... I should have known. The Ministry would sooner destroy its heritage than allow its people to see the truth. It's not like it matters to them. If they ever need new specimens they know they can just attack Osmia again. That lab was merely a formality. If news of our raid gets out at all, I'm sure it'll be spun as an accident, though even that is doubtful."
There were Federation scientists there too. Why?

"You think the Federation didn't know about us? I'm sure they've briefed all the rest that we're some dangerous threat. That way, if we ever tried to start another civil war, the Federation wouldn't hesitate to side with the Ministry. But that's besides the point. I shouldn't be so grim. We didn't save everyone. We couldn't have. But we still saved dozens of our people, and we may finally recover some of our lost history. But as the leader of my people I have failed to prepare us for such outcomes. I cannot return to Osmia. I humbly request that you accept my services, captain."
이 송신소는 아름답고 무성하게 자란 정글 행성의 궤도에 세워진 것으로 보였습니다. 식물로 가득한 거대한 동굴의 중심부엔 졸탄 사원이 있었고 비교적 구시대적 기술로 보이지만 그 사원을 보호하는 휴면 무인선도 있습니다.
안에 있는 수도승들을 부른다.
대화를 시도하지만 사원에는 통신을 받는 시스템조차 없는 것 같습니다. 더 가까이 가서 착륙하자 수도승이 환영합니다. "반갑습니다 여행자들. 이 성지에선 기부금이 없어도 누구나 환영합니다."
안쪽을 둘러본다.
사원의 대부분은 여기저기 값싼 조각상들과 관리되지 않고 훼손된 상태였습니다. 중앙 강당에서 많은 수도승이 원을 그리며 명상하고 있었습니다. 주지 스님이 눈을 뜨고 인사했습니다. "당신은 연방에서 오신 손님입니까? 들어오시죠, 깨달음의 길에 함께하며, 평화의 신들의 축복을 받으시길 바랍니다."
명상에 참여한다.
유감스럽지만, 가봐야 할 것 같습니다.
"그렇습니까, 친구여. 안전한 여행길이 되길 바랍니다."
신경 쓰지 않는다.
졸탄 수도승이 되는 것이 어떤 것인지 궁금하지만 임무만큼 중요한 것은 아니였습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
무인기를 요격한다, 사원을 약탈하자!
무인기를 요격하면 무방비 상태인 사원에 접근할 수 있습니다.
계속...
사원을 무시한다.
졸탄 사원에 흥미로운 것은 없었습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
다른 수도승들 사이에 앉아서 그들의 경건한 예배에 합류했습니다. 갑자기 잠에서 깨어나 시간이 얼마나 흘렀는지 깨닫자 거의 반나절이 지났습니다...
계속...
수도승들은 당신의 방문에 대해 간결하게 감사를 표했고, 당신은 떠나면서 이상한 느낌이 자신을 감싸는 것을 느꼈습니다... 마치 축복받은 것처럼 말이죠.
예상대로 사원은 스스로를 완전히 방어할 수 없었습니다. 비폭력을 맹세한 수도승들은 자신이 가진 모든 것을 포기해야했지만 전리품으로 받은 자원은 많지 않았습니다.
수도승들은 보급품들을 포기하기를 거부했습니다. "우린 폭력을 필요치 아니하며, 요구에 굴하지 않을 겁니다. 우린 평화로운 사람들입니다. 당신이 더 잘 알고 있지 않습니까?"
그들을 풀어준다.
더 이상 할 수 있는 것도 없으며, 무방비 상태의 수도승 무리를 죽일 준비도 되지 않았습니다.
모든 수도승을 죽인다.
무고한 수도승 무리를 무자비하게 학살했으며, 사소한 스크랩 수색의 일환으로 불필요한 살육을 저질렀습니다. 이 무의미한 행동으로 얻은 건 뭡니까? 연료 전지와 명상하는 도금 졸탄 조각상은 3 스크랩보다도 가치가 없습니다.
근처의 수도원이 당신을 불렀으며, 건장한 수도승이 화면에 나타났습니다. "안녕하십니까. 전 최근에 이 수도원에 합류했지만, 이 성운에서 고립된 삶은 저와 맞지 않다는 것을 알게 되었습니다. 혹시 당신과 함께 가도 됩니까? 전 평화주의 신념에 헌신하지만, 다른 방면으로 유용합니다!"
승선을 허락한다.
미안하지만 더 이상의 승무원은 필요 없습니다.
"어... 알겠습니다." 통신을 종료하고 계속 나아갔습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
이 송신소엔 졸탄 수도원이 세워졌습니다. 그들은 당신을 환영하고 그들의 사원을 둘러보겠냐고 제안했습니다.
사원을 여행하는 것을 수락한다.
'여행'은 여행이라기 보다 수도승의 종교에 대한 기나긴 설교에 가까웠습니다. 그것이 다소 지루하게 느껴졌지만, 승무원 중 한명이 확신했습니다. 놀랍게도 그 수도승들화 함께 하고 싶어 했습니다!
허락한다. 가게 둔다.
승무원이 손을 흔들며 작별을 고했습니다. 수도승들은 당신이 얼마나 힘든 결정을 내렸는지 이해하며 동정을 표했습니다. 위안이지만, 수도승들은 선체를 수리해주고 반응로를 무료로 업그레이드해줬습니다.
승무원이 죽지 않았기에 복제될 수 없습니다.
거절한다.
승무원을 위로하며 이 현실을 구해야 수도승들에게 돌아갈 수 있다며, 임무가 더 중요하다는 것을 설명했습니다.
사양한다.
수도원을 여행하지 않기로 결정했습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
늙고 웅크리고 있는 늙은 수도승이 당신의 함선에 컵 모양으로 손을 내밀었습니다. "반갑습니다. 여행자들이여, 저는 하루를 비루하기 위해 여분의 스크랩을 찾는 미천한 졸탄입니다. 이곳에서의 생활은 험난합니다. 이해하시리라 믿습니다."
그에게 스크랩을 준다.
늙은 수도승에게 스크랩을 쥐어줬습니다.
계속...
거절한다.
"오 정말 감사합니다, 정말 자애로우시군요." 다른 말 없이 수도승은 떠났습니다.
"오 정말 감사합니다, 정말 자애로우시군요. 아마 당신과 함께 하고싶군요... 당신은 정말 좋은 사람들처럼 보입니다."
"오 정말 감사합니다, 정말 자애로우시군요. 가진 것은 별로 없지만, 예전에 반응로에 대해 좀 알고 있었습니다. 당신의 반응로에 약간의 작업을 해 드릴 수 있습니다."
"괜찮습니다... 전 이해할 수 있습니다" 다른 말 없이 수도승은 떠났습니다.
수도사가 똑바로 서니 몇 년은 젊어 보였습니다. 그는 로브를 벗어던지고 블래스터를 들었습니다! "큭 큭 선장, 좀 더 가지고 다녔어야지!" 졸탄 몇 명이 더 나타나며, 해적선이 다가왔습니다.
계속...
연방 함선이 이 송신소에 갇혀서 엔진이 고장난 것을 보고 충격을 받았습니다. "오, 안 좋은 때에 오셨습니다. 사실... 당신에게는 운이 좋은 시간이겠군요. 우린 엔진을 수리하려면 스크랩이 필요한데, 여기 수도승들은 우릴 도와주는데 쓸모없더군요. 우린 스크랩을 모으기위해 기꺼이 당신에게 보급품을 팔겠습니다."
거래를 수락한다.
수리를 위해 약간의 스크랩을 준다. [-25~]
"오, 만세! 정말 감사드립니다. 그래도 우린 무상으로 이걸 받을 수 없습니다. 여기, 이 섹터를 여행하는 동안 우리가 발견한 세부 지도를 드리겠습니다, 이건 도움이 될 것입니다. 엔진만 고치면 되니까 소정의 연료도 받아주세요. 우린 충분히 가지고 있습니다."
아무것도 사지 않는다.
연방 함선에 사과하고 계속 진행했습니다.
함선에서 무언가를 한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
근처에 있는 수도승 함선은 조종 방법을 모르는 것처럼 이상하게 움직이고 있습니다. 보통 평화적인 수도승 함선과는 달리 녹슨 미사일 발사기도 그 위에 장착되어있었습니다.
그들에게 연락한다.
수도승 함선은 음성으로 대답하지 않고 오히려 메세지를 보냈습니다. "반갑소이다. 이 함선은 더는 졸탄 수도승의 소유가 아닙니다. 우리는 유령들입니다. 이 함선은 무장이 빈약하관데 탄약도 빈약하건데 우리에게 소량의 탄약을 주지 아니하겠습니까?"
5개의 미사일을 준다.
"선물은 잘 받았소이다. 이 감사의 표시를 받아주길." 스크랩이나 연료가 필요하지만 대신 유령 승무원이 함선에 나타났습니다!
10개의 미사일을 준다.
"예상치 못했거늘 어찌 이리 많은 탄약을 줬단 말인가. 부디 부탁하건대 감사의 표시를 받아주길." 스크랩이나 연료가 필요하지만 대신 유령 승무원이 함선에 나타났습니다!
탄약이 얼마 없다는 것은, 매우 쉬운 표적이라는 뜻이다!
유령을 돕는 것을 거절하고 그들을 공격하는 것을 택했습니다.
계속...
